messages.message: Hmm, maybe it’s because accordions always hide overflow via `contain: paint`. Maybe try replacing the accordion w/ a div that just has `contain: paint` on it & see if the issue is reproducible?
What if the wrapper div uses `overflow: hidden` instead of `contain: paint`? Does that make any difference or is the issue the same

`overflow: hidden` creates a scroll container (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Scroll_container) while `contain: paint` doesn’t.
If you put your editor back in an accordion but wrap the accordion content in an `overflow:hidden` div I bet it’ll work as expected
But it might not depending on how the browser optimized offscreen paints https://css-tricks.com/lets-take-a-deep-dive-into-the-css-contain-property/#aa-paint-containment
Yeah just tried it, if that parent has contain: paint, overflow: hidden on the child still doesn't work :confused: hmmmm
Maybe I can make it so that once it's fully open I take off the contain: paint?
Or honestly I might just take it out of the accordion haha
I may be able to just replace `contain: paint` with `overflow: hidden` on accordion
